programme.title: The Last Castle (2001)
programme.desc: A court-martialed general (Robert Redford) leads a revolt against a corrupt warden (James Gandolfini) in a military prison.

programme.title: The Godfather (1972)
programme.desc: Crime boss Vito Corleone and his sons, the ruthless yet loyal members of the Corleone family, rule their secretive New York empire with an iron fist.

programme.title: The Score (2001)
programme.desc: A master thief (Robert De Niro) agrees to work with a volatile partner (Edward Norton) for one last heist before he retires.

programme.title: The Yards (2000)
programme.desc: A friends lure of easy money draws an ex-con into the corrupt world of his uncles subway-train business.

programme.title: Backcountry (2014)
programme.desc: A couple (Missy Peregrym, Jeff Roop) on a deep-wilderness hike become hopelessly lost within an aggressive black bears territory.

programme.title: The Killer Inside Me (2010)
programme.desc: An encounter with an aggressive prostitute (Jessica Alba) brings a Texas lawmans (Casey Affleck) homicidal tendencies screaming to the surface.

programme.title: Undisputed III: Redemption (2010)
programme.desc: Uri Boyka is an inmate trapped in the toughest prison in the world. He is ready to make his comeback in a lethal boxing competition for a shot at freedom.

programme.title: The Girl in the Pool (2024)
programme.desc: A mans life collapses when his mistress is found dead in his pool. Terrified of the consequences and desperate to protect his family, he conceals the truth, triggering a chaotic night that threatens to unravel his perfect life.

programme.title: Captive (2015)
programme.desc: Recovering drug addict Ashley Smith (Kate Mara) reads Rick Warrens "The Purpose Driven Life" as armed fugitive Brian Nichols (David Oyelowo) holds her hostage in her apartment.

programme.title: Barrons Cove (2024)
programme.desc: A man with a violent past kidnaps the boy he holds responsible for his sons death. As he grows closer to uncovering the truth, hes left to wonder whether his pursuers are really seeking to protect the boy, or merely the secrets he keeps.

programme.title: Equilibrium (2002)
programme.desc: In the future a government agent (Christian Bale) and a band of rebels battle a regime that uses a drug to suppress peoples emotions.

programme.title: Dont Knock Twice (2016)
programme.desc: A mother looking to reconnect with her estranged daughter attracts the attention of a demonic witch.

programme.title: Twisted (2004)
programme.desc: With help from her partner (Andy Garcia), a police inspector (Ashley Judd) searches for a killer who is murdering her former lovers.

programme.title: Changing Lanes (2002)
programme.desc: An attorney and a recovering alcoholic have a car accident which swiftly escalates into an ongoing, bitter feud.

programme.title: The Contractor (2022)
programme.desc: When his new assignment goes awry, an elite soldier finds himself hunted and on the run, caught in a dangerous conspiracy and fighting to stay alive long enough to get home and uncover the true motives of those who betrayed him.

programme.title: The Foreigner (2017)
programme.desc: A businessman embarks on a revenge-fueled vendetta after his daughter dies in a terrorist bombing. His search leads to a cat-and-mouse conflict with a British government official whose past may hold the clues to the identities of the elusive killers.

programme.title: Barrons Cove (2024)
programme.desc: A man with a violent past kidnaps the boy he holds responsible for his sons death. As he grows closer to uncovering the truth, hes left to wonder whether his pursuers are really seeking to protect the boy, or merely the secrets he keeps.

programme.title: Switchback (1997)
programme.desc: A college student (Jared Leto) and a former rail worker (Danny Glover) are suspects in an FBI agents (Dennis Quaid) hunt for a serial killer who abducted his son.

programme.title: Get Rich or Die Tryin (2005)
programme.desc: When his world spirals out of control, a drug dealer wants to leave his violent life behind and pursue his dream of becoming a rap artist. He channels the same manic intensity to his writing as he does to dealing.

programme.title: Undisputed (2002)
programme.desc: An undefeated world-champion prizefighter, who is convicted of rape and sent to prison, must confront and fight the reigning prison boxing champion.

programme.title: Wildcat (2021)
programme.desc: A captive reporter must figure out a way to escape from the militants who ambushed her convoy in the Middle East.

programme.title: The Bye Bye Man (2017)
programme.desc: A couple (Douglas Smith, Cressida Bonas) and their friend (Lucien Laviscount) stumble upon the horrific origins of the Bye Bye Man (Doug Jones), a mysterious figure that they discover is the root cause of the evil behind the most unspeakable acts.

programme.title: The Survivalist (2021)
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: Drop Zone (1994)
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (Wesley Snipes) turns skydiver to nab a hijacker (Gary Busey) and his parachutist gang planning to invade the DEA.

programme.title: The Last Stop in Yuma County (2023)
programme.sub-title: The Last Stop in Yuma County (2023)
programme.desc: Stranded at an Arizona rest stop, a traveling knife salesman gets thrust into a high-stakes hostage situation by the arrival of two bank robbers who will stop at nothing to protect their ill-begotten fortune.

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: A law-school grad uncovers a sinister secret about the Tennessee firm that made him an offer he couldnt refuse.

programme.title: Cop Land (1997)
programme.desc: The sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) of a small New Jersey police community confronts key men (Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta) on both sides of a law-enforcement cover-up.

programme.title: Serpico (1973)
programme.desc: Based on the true story of Frank Serpico, who sacrificed his career to expose widespread corruption in the NYPD.

programme.title: Sleeping Dogs (2024)
programme.desc: Suffering from memory loss, a former homicide detective tries to solve a brutal murder that he cant recall. As he pieces together evidence from a decade-old investigation, he soon uncovers a sinister web of buried secrets tied to his forgotten past.

programme.title: American Assassin (2017)
programme.desc: Cold War veteran Stan Hurley takes CIA black ops recruit Mitch Rapp under his wing, and they join forces with a lethal Turkish agent to stop a mysterious operative who wants to start a global war.

programme.title: Scream 4 (2011)
programme.desc: The Ghostface Killer returns with a vengeance when self-help author Sidney Prescott arrives in Woodsboro on the last stop of her book tour.

programme.title: The Beldham (2024)
programme.desc: A struggling new mother fights a generations-old presence lurking within her familys home, threatening her safety, her sanity, and the life of her infant child.

programme.title: Boudica: Queen of War (2023)
programme.desc: Roman conquerors slay King Prasutagus, take away his children, and force his wife, Boudica, into subservience. Consumed by grief and a burning desire for justice, Boudica vows to reclaim her homeland from the clutches of the Romans.

programme.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
programme.sub-title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
programme.desc: Kyle, Stan and Cartman orchestrate a resistance to an imminent war between Canada and the United States.

programme.title: Superhero Movie (2008)
programme.desc: A teenage loser (Drake Bell) transforms into a caped crusader when a bite from a genetically altered bug gives him superhuman abilities.

programme.title: The Score (2001)
programme.desc: A master thief (Robert De Niro) agrees to work with a volatile partner (Edward Norton) for one last heist before he retires.

programme.title: The Lookout (2007)
programme.desc: A brain-damaged former athlete (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) finds himself pulled into a heist at the bank where he works as a janitor.

programme.title: The Outlaws (2024)
programme.desc: A group of outlaws awaken to their empty train heist bag. Interrogations begin as each cowboy becomes the focus in an attempt to unmask the thief among them. Tensions mount as each bandit struggles to clear their name before bullets fly.

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: Pixie sets out to avenge her mothers death and attempts a heist that will give her the means to leave her small-town life behind. When the plan goes horribly wrong, shes forced to team up with a pair of misfits who are clearly in over their heads.

programme.title: Top Gun (1986)
programme.desc: For Lieutenant Pete "Maverick" Mitchell and his friend and co-pilot Nick "Goose" Bradshaw, being accepted into an elite training school for fighter pilots is a dream come true. But a tragedy will threaten Petes dreams of becoming an ace pilot.

programme.title: Winter Spring Summer or Fall (2024)
programme.desc: Young Remi has her future figured out, until she meets Barnes, who lives for the moment and makes her question everything. As their love story unfolds, she faces a choice -- stick to her plan or risk it all for a life she never saw coming.

programme.title: Just Like Heaven (2005)
programme.desc: A San Francisco widower (Mark Ruffalo) falls in love with a ghostly doctor (Reese Witherspoon) while subletting her apartment.

programme.title: Election (1999)
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: Superstar (1999)
programme.desc: An energetic schoolgirl (Molly Shannon) hopes to win a talent contest where a prize as a movie extra might lead to her first kiss.

programme.title: Til Death Do Us Part (2017)
programme.desc: Madison Roland finds love with another man after she leaves her abusive husband, Michael, and changes her identity. All seems well, until Michael discovers Madisons whereabouts and re-creates her nightmare all over again.

programme.title: Ask the Dust (2006)
programme.desc: In Depression-era Los Angeles, a fiery Mexican waitress (Salma Hayek) who wants to improve her lot through marriage meets an aspiring writer (Colin Farrell) of Italian descent.

programme.title: The Beldham (2024)
programme.desc: A struggling new mother fights a generations-old presence lurking within her familys home, threatening her safety, her sanity, and the life of her infant child.

programme.title: The First Wives Club (1996)
programme.desc: Three 50-ish college friends (Goldie Hawn, Bette Midler, Diane Keaton) plot revenge after their husbands dump them for younger women.

programme.title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
programme.sub-title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton! (2004)
programme.desc: Secretly in love with his friend (Kate Bosworth), a supermarket manager (Topher Grace) becomes jealous when she meets a famous actor (Josh Duhamel).

programme.title: End of Sentence (2019)
programme.desc: After being released from prison, a young man reluctantly embarks on a journey with his estranged father to spread his mothers ashes in her native Ireland.

programme.title: I Love You, I Love You Not (1997)
programme.sub-title: I Love You, I Love You Not (1997)
programme.desc: A Jewish prep school student (Claire Danes) shares stories of anti-Semitism with her grandmother (Jeanne Moreau), an Auschwitz survivor.

programme.title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)
programme.sub-title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)
programme.desc: After serving time for a crime he did not commit, a vengeful barber (Johnny Depp) and his accomplice (Helena Bonham Carter) carve up unlucky customers and bake them in meat pies.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives (2004)
programme.desc: A man and his wife move to a quaint suburb where most of the women seem to have the same bland personality.

programme.title: Love Me if You Dare! (2024)
programme.desc: A man develops romantic feelings for a ghost.

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: Pixie sets out to avenge her mothers death and attempts a heist that will give her the means to leave her small-town life behind. When the plan goes horribly wrong, shes forced to team up with a pair of misfits who are clearly in over their heads.

programme.title: Love, Rosie (2014)
programme.desc: Rosie and Alex are best friends until Alexs family moves to America. They gamble everything to keep their love and friendship alive over the years and miles.

programme.title: No Strings Attached (2011)
programme.desc: After sex enters the equation, two lifelong friends (Natalie Portman, Ashton Kutcher) make a pact to keep their relationship purely physical.

programme.title: The Romantics (2010)
programme.desc: Longtime rivalries resurface in the hours before a woman is scheduled to marry the former lover of her college roommate.

programme.title: Roman Holiday (1953)
programme.desc: A young princess (Audrey Hepburn), tired of her constraints, runs off with a U.S. newsman (Gregory Peck) in Rome.

programme.title: Like Water for Chocolate (1992)
programme.desc: The youngest daughter (Lumi Cavazos) of a Mexican family expresses her feelings in preparing wonderful food, when tradition keeps her from marrying her true love (Marco Leonardi).

programme.title: The Words (2012)
programme.desc: An aspiring writer pays a heavy price after he finds another mans long-lost manuscript and passes it off as his own.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert (2015)
programme.desc: Gertrude Bells life as an explorer, cartographer, and archaeologist for the British Empire.

programme.title: Becoming Jane (2007)
programme.desc: Though her parents expect her to marry a wealthy suitor, young Jane Austen (Anne Hathaway) becomes involved with a penniless lawyer (James McAvoy) who inspires her future writings.

programme.title: Sabrina (1995)
programme.desc: Sons (Harrison Ford, Greg Kinnear) of a Long Island tycoon become romantic rivals for the chauffeurs daughter (Julia Ormond).

programme.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
programme.desc: During the Civil War, a wounded Confederate soldier (Jude Law) abandons his duties to make his way home to his sweetheart (Nicole Kidman).

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love (1998)
programme.desc: Young William Shakespeare (Joseph Fiennes) falls for Viola (Gwyneth Paltrow), reawakening his creativity, but she is betrothed to Wessex.

programme.title: Mothers Day (2016)
programme.desc: As Mothers Day draws near, a single mom (Jennifer Aniston) learns that her ex-husband (Timothy Olyphant) is marrying a younger woman (Shay Mitchell), while a recently widowed man (Jason Sudeikis) struggles to raise his two daughters.

programme.title: Shes the Man (2006)
programme.desc: Romantic complications ensue when a student poses as her twin brother and replaces him at his boarding school.

programme.title: Bottom of the 9th (2019)
programme.desc: After serving 17 years in prison for a violent mistake he made in his youth, a once-aspiring baseball player returns to his Bronx neighborhood.

programme.title: Shes All That (1999)
programme.desc: A cool teen (Freddie Prinze Jr.) bets a friend that he can transform the schools geekiest girl (Rachael Leigh Cook) into a prom queen.

programme.title: Rosemarys Baby (1968)
programme.desc: A pregnant womans (Mia Farrow) husband (John Cassavetes) and their satanic neighbors want her baby to be the Antichrist.

programme.title: Personal Shopper (2016)
programme.desc: A young American in Paris works as a personal shopper for a celebrity. She seems to have the ability to communicate with spirits, like her recently deceased twin brother. Soon, she starts to receive ambiguous messages from an unknown source.

programme.title: Heatwave (2022)
programme.desc: A womans life takes an unexpected turn when she falls for her bosss wife. She must soon defend herself as she becomes entangled in a web of malice.

programme.title: Election (1999)
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: Superstar (1999)
programme.desc: An energetic schoolgirl (Molly Shannon) hopes to win a talent contest where a prize as a movie extra might lead to her first kiss.

programme.title: Jersey Girl (2004)
programme.desc: A young woman (Liv Tyler) changes the life of a single father (Ben Affleck) who used to be a successful New York music publicist.

programme.title: Bridget Joness Baby (2016)
programme.desc: Befuddled mom-to-be Bridget Jones (Renee Zellweger) must figure out which of the two men (Colin Firth, Patrick Dempsey) in her life is the father of her child.

programme.title: Just Like Heaven (2005)
programme.desc: A San Francisco widower (Mark Ruffalo) falls in love with a ghostly doctor (Reese Witherspoon) while subletting her apartment.

programme.title: Election (1999)

programme.title: Shell (2024)
programme.desc: Desperate to reclaim her career, once-beloved actress Samantha Lake gets drawn into the glamorous world of wellness mogul Zoe Shannon, only to uncover a monstrous truth beneath the seemingly flawless surface.

programme.desc: Sparky Sparkes and his family travel to fish and have adventures in the U.S. and abroad.
